metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11935 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that aufs improperly managed inode reference counts in the vfsub_dentry_open() method. A local attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service attack. Mauricio Faria de Oliveira discovered that the aufs implementation in the Linux kernel improperly managed inode reference counts in the vfsub_dentry_open() method. A local attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11935` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-42-generic - 5.4.0-42.46
linux-image-5.4.0-42-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-42.46
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-42-generic - 5.4.0-42.46
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-42-lowlatency - 5.4.0-42.46
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1020-aws - 5.4.0-1020.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1022-azure - 5.4.0-1022.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1021-gcp - 5.4.0-1021.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1020-kvm - 5.4.0-1020.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1021-oracle - 5.4.0-1021.21
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1015-raspi - 5.4.0-1015.15
No subscription required
